summary: This is a superseding indictment filed in the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York against Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with five counts related to the sexual exploitation and abuse of multiple minor girls by Jeffrey Epstein, detailing her role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the abuse from approximately 1994 to 2004, and her alleged perjury in 2016. This is a superseding indictment filed in the Southern District of New York against Ghislaine Maxwell, detailing charges of conspiracy to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts, sex trafficking of a minor, and perjury. It outlines specific overt acts involving a minor victim (Minor Victim-4) and alleges false statements made by Maxwell during a 2016 deposition.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and sex trafficking for her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a co-conspirator; the individual for whom minors, including Minor Victim-4, were recruited to engage in commercial sex acts.

persons.name: Minor Victim-4
persons.context: A minor recruited between 2001-2004 to engage in sex acts with Epstein at his Palm Beach residence, and who was also encouraged to recruit other girls.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney who signed and filed the superseding indictment.

connections.description: Maxwell and Epstein conspired to entice, groom, transport, and traffic minor girls for sexual abuse, as alleged in the indictment.
Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his various properties between approximately 1994 and 2004.
Maxwell and Epstein were in an intimate relationship between approximately 1994 and 1997 and were among each other's closest associates.
Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated Epstein's access to minor victims, knowing of his sexual preference for underage girls and his intent to abuse them.
Maxwell is charged with recruiting, enticing, and obtaining Minor Victim-4, knowing she was under 18, to engage in commercial sex acts with Epstein.
Epstein engaged in commercial sex acts with Minor Victim-4 at his Palm Beach residence and provided her with cash.

events.title: Conspiracy and Abuse Period
events.description: The timeframe during which Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein allegedly conspired to and did entice, groom, transport, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-1
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein groomed and sexually abused Minor Victim-1, starting when she was approximately 14, including group sexual encounters in New York and Florida.

events.title: Grooming of Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell interacted with Minor Victim-2 at Epstein's New Mexico ranch, providing an unsolicited topless massage and encouraging her to massage Epstein.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-3 in London
events.description: Maxwell groomed Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged her to provide massages during which Epstein sexually abused her.

events.title: Sex Trafficking of Minor Victim-4
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein recruited, paid, and groomed Minor Victim-4 (starting at age ~14) for sexualized massages at the Palm Beach Residence and encouraged her to recruit other underage girls.

events.title: Maxwell's Alleged Perjury
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell repeatedly provided false statements under oath during a civil deposition regarding her role in facilitating Epstein's abuse of minor victims.

events.title: Recruitment and Abuse of Minor Victim-4
events.description: Epstein and Maxwell recruited Minor Victim-4 to engage in sex acts with Epstein at his Palm Beach residence, paid her hundreds of dollars per encounter, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.

events.title: Delivery of Gifts to Minor Victim-4
events.description: Epstein caused a package (including lingerie) to be sent via Federal Express from Manhattan to Minor Victim-4's residence in Florida.

events.title: Maxwell's First Perjurious Deposition
events.description: During a deposition, Maxwell gave false testimony, denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme to recruit underage girls and claiming she was not aware of interacting with anyone under 18 other than the plaintiff.

events.title: Maxwell's Second Perjurious Deposition
events.description: During a deposition, Maxwell gave false testimony regarding her awareness of sex toys at Epstein's Palm Beach house, Epstein's sexual activities with others, and whether she had ever given massages.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Residence)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for the indictment)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with five federal counts: conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and sex trafficking conspiracy.

The indictment alleges Maxwell played a central role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the sexual abuse of at least four minor victims (identified as Minor Victim-1 through -4) for Jeffrey Epstein from approximately 1994 to 2004.
Victims were as young as 14 years old and were abused at Epstein's properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and at Maxwell's residence in London.
Maxwell and Epstein allegedly created a network of underage victims, paying some victims to recruit other girls for Epstein to abuse.
Maxwell is accused of committing perjury during a 2016 civil deposition by lying about her role in facilitating Epstein's abuse.
The indictment charges Ghislaine Maxwell with conspiracy, sex trafficking of a minor, and two counts of perjury.
It details the specific recruitment and abuse of 'Minor Victim-4' between 2001 and 2004, including cash payments and encouragement to recruit other girls.
The perjury charges stem from false statements Maxwell made in 2016 depositions, denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme and her own involvement.
The document is a formal superseding indictment filed by the U.S. Attorney's Office, indicating the progression of the federal case against Maxwell.
